channel.title: Great Books Every Catholic Should Know
channel.desc: Three great books by two Catholic converts are on tap in today?s episode. Joseph Pearce looks at Robert Hugh Benson?s ?By What Authority?? and ?Lord of the World? and G.K. Chesterton's ?The Man Who Was Thursday.?. (30 minutes).

channel.title: new! Ewtn Bookmark
channel.desc: Evangelist, author, business executive, and art lover, Steve Auth joins Doug to discuss Sacred Art?s ability to teach the deeper truths of the Church, the Mass and the Eucharist. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: The Spirit Of Catholic Leadership
channel.desc: Fr. Spitzer continues his discussion of the "Four Levels of Success" and the impact the levels can have on personal and professional lives. Level four comes with a surrender to God in the form of a "Thy will be done" perspective. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Setting Captives Free: A Deeper Look At Ignatian Discernment Of Spirits
channel.desc: Using real life experiences, Fr. Gallagher explains the methodology behind St. Ignatius? teaching on the discernment of spirits, both good and evil, as well as states of consolation and desolation. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Le Chapelet De La Divine Misericorde
channel.desc: The Chaplet of the Divine Mercy is prayed in French by the parish of Our Lady of the Nativity in La Garde, France. Our Lord taught Sister Faustina in Poland, the five decades to recite. Spoken and sung with portrayals of Jesus' Passion and Resurrection. (15 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Reflections With Fr. Leo Clifford
channel.desc: Father Leo Clifford develops this talk around our names and what we do to identify ourselves to others. He shows various ways St. John the Evangelist is known and goes on to say that we are the masters of our own fate in how we are known to the world. (15 minutes).

channel.title: Father Spitzer?s Universe
channel.desc: Fr. Spitzer and Dough Keck answer viewer questions about the faith, conferring over the scientific evidence for the Big Bang and discussing how to pray for deceased friends. (60 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: The Hour Of The Laity
channel.desc: An interview with TV news anchor Monica Hannan from KFYR in Bismarck, North Dakota on the current state of the news media and a Catholic?s duty to speak the truth at all times. (30 minutes).

channel.title: Great Books Every Catholic Should Know

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Vaticano
channel.desc: This week on Vaticano: Reflect on the legacy and final days of Pope Francis, examine his enduring relationship with Pope Benedict XVI, and reveal the stories of popes laid to rest beyond Vatican walls. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Church And The Poor
channel.desc: Volunteers from Long Island, New York share with Fr. Ho Lung their experiences working with the poor, how it has strengthened their faith and spiritual life and what they discovered. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: An Ewtn Holy Land Experience
channel.desc: The exploration of St. Peter's remarkable life continues with a visit to many of the Holy Land sites where he faced his most difficult trials as an apostle and servant of God. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Mother Angelica Live Classics
channel.desc: Mother explains how we can serve God no matter what our vocation in life. (60 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: new! Sunday Vespers With Benediction
channel.desc: Join the Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word as they celebrate Vespers and Benediction of the Blessed Sacrament from Our Lady of the Angels Chapel in Irondale, Alabama. (35 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Sunday Best With Fr. Groeschel
channel.desc: On today?s program, Fr. Groeschel discusses the meaning of the Mass, comparing the current service to the way it was celebrated in the early Church. He also explores what the Eucharist means for the faithful. (25 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Ewtn Pro Life Weekly
channel.desc: Every week, Abigail Galv?n and a team of pro-life experts shine the light of truth on abortion, euthanasia, assisted suicide, and the culture of death. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: new! Life On The Rock
channel.desc: The friars continue their interview of Fr. Nathan Cromly to discuss the timeless leadership of St. Paul, as well as his book, ?Coached by Paul the Apostle.?. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Icons
channel.desc: On their mission to Haiti, the Franciscan Friars get to work building homes and tearing down a burned out orphanage school. While they work, they spread Christ?s love throughout the community. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: A Force For Good
channel.desc: Host Jay Richards learns how businessman John Abbate integrated his work as a McDonald's franchise owner with his Catholic faith and interviews Sam Gregg of the Acton Institute on minimum wage laws and the Church's teaching on a just wage. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Ewtn Live
channel.desc: Author and journalist, Patrick Novecosky, joins Fr. Mitch to discuss the many ways in which the life and pontificate of Pope St. John Paul II impacted the world. (60 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Bob And Penny Lord Present
channel.desc: Bob and Penny Lord highlight the miracles and ministry of beloved saint, St. Anthony of Padua. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: The Wild Goose
channel.desc: Fr. Dave Pivonka, TOR, describes the special connection Mary has had with the Holy Spirit since her conception. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Marriage: For Better...forever!
channel.desc: Marriage Counsler Greg Popcak Discusses the action, challenge, and choice to love, and offers advice on how to make married love stay everyday. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Living Right With Dr. Ray
channel.desc: Learn about a technique to help parents teach lasting lessons to quarreling siblings. Plus, HeartBeat International?s director outlines her approach to transforming relationships. (60 minutes).

channel.desc: Dr. Scott Hahn and Mike Aquilina explore the history and meaning of the Christian economy. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Chaplet Of Divine Mercy
channel.desc: From the chapel of the National Shrine of the Divine Mercy in Stockbridge, Massachusetts. (20 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Reflections With Fr. Leo Clifford
channel.desc: Father Leo Clifford reflects on some of the writings of Fr. Frederick William Faber of England concerning the Blessed Sacrament and some of the devotions we have - 40 Hours, Perpetual Adoration, visits. (10 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: Crossing The Goal
channel.desc: Former NFL Wide-Receiver Danny Abramowicz and team talk about countering envy with gratitude in this hard-hitting look at Catholic spirituality for men. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: The Hour Of The Laity
channel.desc: An interview with TV news anchor Monica Hannan from KFYR in Bismarck, North Dakota on the current state of the news media and a Catholic?s duty to speak the truth at all times. (30 minutes).

channel.name: EWTN ZA
channel.title: First Communion
channel.desc: Mischievous boys, under the misapprehension that a "pirate's treasure" is hidden somewhere in the village church, learn from an orphan girl that the greatest treasure is in the tabernacle, the Body and Blood of Jesus Christ. (30 minutes).
